command.prompt:
Generate 3 new rows for a table of information about mythical creatures. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Word
Chimera
Siren
Basilisk
Minotaur
Cyclops
Unicorns
Pegasus
Centaur
Gorgon
Phoenix
Hydra
Cerberus
Nymph

Output the rows in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin
Mermaid, half-human, half-fish creature;Siren;Ariel, The Little Mermaid;Maritime folklore
Dragon, large, serpent-like creature;Drake, Wyrm;Serpent, Worm;Multiple origins
command.epilogue:
1. Satyr: Britannica, last updated August 26, 2021, <https://www.britannica.com/topic/satyr>
2. Mermaid: Britannica, last updated December 9, 2021, <https://www.britannica.com/topic/mermaid>
3. Dragon: Encyclopedia Britannica, last updated January 2, 2022, <https://www.britannica.com/topic/dragon>
